Articles.Content:
Hi Guys and Gals .... again (for those that saw my last post)

As I mentioned in my last post I use to play the game while it was in Beta, but then took a break until it was released I thought now would be a good time as at the moment I also have a lot of time to spare.

Anyway, when i use to play I had LOADS of mods running with the game which was why I use to have my RAM running almost at MAX, especially if i had Firefox running. Anyhoot, after some googling and forum reading Im sure ...... well 90% sure I found a mod which lowered my RAM usage by almost half I was so happy, I should mention I already have 'ATM X86 Aggressive' (Active Texture Management) which I was also using last time as well as this other mod or program (it could have been a program that ran in the background I guess).

Anyway I hope someone out there know what I am talking about or maybe someone just happens to know of a mod that does the same thing whether its what i used before or not. Thank you in advance as well if you are able to help me.

 

Vitavoro

Really don't see what (Active Texture Management) does for you know has most of KSP is already dds and that plugin has pretty much my guess has been replace with Dynamic Texture Loader http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/128660-1051-64-feb-1-2016-dynamic-texture-loader/

Its ok I figured it out , is was the old " -force -opengl" (Not forgetting the space at the start either) and it still works like a charm my RAM usage dropped by about 40-45%

 

FANTASTIC!!!!

 

Vitavoro
